title: New: Daniel Wilson – The Exercise
content: With the same kind of modern soul as Sam Smith’s Lay Me Down, the main distinction between the aforementioned track and Daniel Wilson is the production budget. Not to come across as condescending, but I’m fairly sure that Wilson would be one of the first to admit that  he could perhaps to do with a state of the art recording studio, however, it is what it is, and given the relative constraints he faces, it’s a wonder that he produces tracks to the quality of The Exercise. Relying upon Wilson’s flexible yet emotive vocals and a slightly choppy organ section, it’s a plea as much as anything, and it’s fantastic.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
